security_audit.summary: Scanned documentation file with Python code examples for financial risk metrics. No executable code, file access, network calls, or data processing. Pure educational content matching stated purpose.

content.value_statement: You need accurate risk measurements for portfolio management. This skill provides formulas and examples for VaR, Sharpe ratio, drawdowns, and other key metrics.
actual_capabilities: Compute volatility, beta, and downside deviation
Generate drawdown analysis and maximum drawdown
Calculate Sharpe, Sortino, Calmar, and Omega ratios
limitations: Documentation only - no executable code provided
Requires user to implement with their own data

prompt_templates.title: Basic risk metrics
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate volatility, Sharpe ratio, and max drawdown for this return series using the formulas provided.

prompt_templates.title: VaR calculation
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute 95% historical VaR and CVaR for these daily returns and explain what the numbers mean.

prompt_templates.title: Portfolio risk
prompt_templates.prompt: Using the portfolio risk class, calculate total portfolio volatility and component risk contributions.

prompt_templates.title: Rolling risk analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement 63-day rolling volatility and Sharpe ratio for monitoring risk changes over time.

output_examples.input: Calculate risk metrics for my strategy returns

best_practices: Use multiple risk metrics for comprehensive analysis
Consider tail risk with both VaR and CVaR
Apply appropriate time horizons for your strategy
anti_patterns: Relying solely on volatility as risk measure

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the documentation works across all platforms.

faq.question: What data do I need to provide?
faq.answer: You need return series data; no market data fetching is included.

faq.question: Can I use this for real-time risk monitoring?
faq.answer: Yes, implement the rolling metrics for continuous monitoring.

faq.question: Does it handle different time frequencies?
faq.answer: Examples use daily data but formulas work for any frequency.

faq.question: What if my returns are not normally distributed?
faq.answer: Use historical VaR or Cornish-Fisher adjustment for skewed data.

faq.question: How does this compare to commercial risk systems?
faq.answer: This provides core calculations; enterprise systems offer more features.
